Reviews.Title: “A pleasant base for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: MerlinYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean and large enough by Venetian standards! A pleasant base to return to after hours spent exploring Venice. The staff were generally friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was fine and although it was too early in the year to sit on the roof terrace, we had a look up there and it must be a great place to enjoy breakfast in the summer. They don't do other meals, but there are enough places to eat out in Venice. Google maps aren't very helpful, but from the bus station at Piazzale Roma, simply walk right over a couple of minor bridges along the grand canal, past the major bridge over the grand canal on your left and (you have to) take a right. Second left then brings you to the church of St Simeon Grand. Go to the left and a courtyard opens up to your left, the hotel entrance faces you, slightly to your left. This is a great base, conveniently located, from which to explore Venice, both by vaporetta and simply wandering the maze of street in the general direction of major attractions, frequentl;y signposted such as Rialto and St Marks. The hotel isn't grand, but is just fine for what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: NoMoreTuition
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at Hotel ai due Fanali. It has been great on each occasion. Modern, clean and great breakfasts. Easy to get to the train station, which is just across one bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at a great place.”
Reviews.Author: goodie7415
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in the last two years. The location is a short walk from the bus stop at Piazzale Roma, on a quiet campo. Clean quiet rooms in an old palace with a roof top breakfast room. The breakfast is fine and the view very nice. The staff was all very friendly, professional, and accommodating. A great value at 90 Euros/day.

Reviews.Title: “great website awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidgreenway
Reviews.Content: terribly disappointing hotel with a website that really does make it look lovely and quaint , but the reality is that the walls and ceilings are very thin, the hotel dirty, the fixtures and fittings are in a bad way and the breakfast and breakfast staff are a bit , no , are, substandard and thats me being polite! AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “TINY ROOM, Dirty Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Denise L
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked terrific, but our room was so small that we literally could not walk in the room once we brought in our suitcases. We had to climb over the suitcases in order to get into or out of bed. It didn't add to the experience that the bathroom was also teeny tiny and grimy in the corners. When we asked if perhaps there was a larger room for us available on the following nights of our stay, we were told that; "You American's are used to large rooms". My husband and I have traveled the world, and have stayed in many, many hotels This by far was the smallest room ever! We disliked it so much, we wanted to leave a day early. They would not refund our money. Location is OK, away from the throngs and on a charming square. Breakfast room and outdoor terrace are pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms and over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Kev2907
Reviews.Content: Based on a number of reviews I had read this hotel seemed to offer exactly what we were looking for. In common with other reviews, I would say it is in a great (quiet) location and is easy to find by Venice standards. However, the hotel itself was a big disappointment. The rooms are tiny - there is about 2ft clearance around the bed, our floor was sloping and the bathroom was absolutely tiny. There was also mold on the rim of the shower. There were a number of mosquitoes in the room which we had to swat. We had to check out early in the morning and they couldn't offer us breakfast since the waiter didn't come in until 7:30. There is also no staff on at night - you must ring the hotel across the square. While the staff are very nice and friendly, I really couldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel excellent location for expolring venice”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2609
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in early August. It is located a short walk from the train station/car parks facing onto a small square. The staff were very helpful, the rooms large by venice standards and the breakfast very good. We particularly liked the roof terrace. There is a lift and the hotel is airconditioned. The location is excellent for exploring venice. All in all a very good experience in Hotel Ai Due Fanali. I would recommend this hotel for its location/price and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Back again, and it was just as good!”
Reviews.Author: Joel_Sandra
Reviews.Content: Having very much enjoyed our first stay at the Hotel ai due Fanali last year, my wife and I returned for the start of a twenty-day trip this summer. All the superlatives in our previous review still apply, and we can now add "consistency". The ai due Fanali continues to be our hotel of choice in Venice. Location - perfect for us. It's a short walk to the train station and the bus plaza, and is convenient to a vaporetto stop. It is in a Venetian neighborhood rather than a touristy area, and is a ten-minute walk from two terrific restaurants - Il Refolo (great salads and wonderful pizza) and La Zucca (excellent vegetarian dishes and good meat dishes as well) - both of which are located near our favorite campo in all of Venice, San Giacomo del Oro. The hotel itself is charming and quite reasonably priced. On both stays our room had a view of the Grand Canal. The room was completely clean, the bathroom was small but not cramped (with a small tub with an excellent showerhead), and the breakfast was excellent with good coffee and set us up nicely for the whole day. The staff was terrific, and made advance reservations for us at both of the above-mentioned restaurants. This was important, as we arrived on the third weekend in July during a major citywide festival. My wife and I do like to walk, so it was a treat to actually enter and leave the touristy part of Venice. For those not so inclined, St. Mark's is just a vaporetto ride away. We very much look forward to our next stay in Venice - which will be at the Hotel ai due Fanali.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: princess1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was suggested by our travel agent. The hotel directions were not clear and we spent 35 minutes dragging our bags up and down the stairs of the bridges. We finally arrived at the hotel and the woman at the desk was ok. We went to our room which was an reasonable size. The comforter was either dirty or just stained. The only way to use their Internet was downstairs in the lobby with our own computer. They charged $5.00 euros for 3 hours $10.00 euros for 5 hours and $20.00 euros for 24 hours. They locked the door at 10:30pm and you had to go to a nearby hotel to get let in. The rest of the staff was reasonably friendly but seemed a little stand offish. It was noisy and I didn't get a good night sleep while we were there. Foe the money I paid for this hotel I was disappointed. I paid less in Rome and Florence and had 4 star hotels there.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel in a quieter part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: TealaLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for 1 night, however we experienced friendly service from the minute we walked through the door. The room was good value, with a small view of the canal and was clean, spacious and nicely decorated with all the facilities you would expect from a mid range hotel. We chose the hotel from others as its location was reasonably close to the large car parks where you have to leave your car. It was also in a quiet area and being close to a ferry station it was not inconvenient for St Marc's Square. The breakfast room was a little hard to find however when we did find it, we found we could sit on the rooftop so we could see Venice. Access to the rooftop however is a little tricky trying to keep hold of your breakfast when climbing up ladder stairs! We did find breakfast was a little limited, they seemed to have run out of certain items and were not replenished.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in great location”
Reviews.Author: disgrun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. It is a little gem of a hotel located on a quiet square close to the Grand Canal and also close to the train station, so that it is easy to get here with luggage. The hotel is in an old building, and the rooms are small, but clean and rather charming, with air conditioning. And the hotel has a (tiny) lift, which is not to be underestimated in a city like Venice where lots of hotels do not have lifts! Breakfast was fairly standard continental style, but the great thing about it was that the hotel has a terrace where breakfast can be eaten, with good views of the area around the little square. It was a lovely way to start the morning. However, the metal steps up to the terrace were steep, so this may not be a good option for those who have impaired mobility. However, there is also a regular breakfast area on the floor below the terrace; this can be reached via the lift. The reception staff was pleasant and efficient, and had a good list of restaurant suggestions for eating out in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pugwashHuddersield
Reviews.Content: Good little hotel with charactor in a quiet part of Venice. Good value for Venice. The breakfast on the terrace is great. The location is easy to find and within walking distance of the train, bus and all the car parks without looking onto them. Enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Francesca-DM
Reviews.Content: My lovely husband made me a great surprise for my 27th birthday, and brought me for a very romantic weekend in Venice. He booked this hotel because he had already been there on a conference, and he liked the atmosphere. I loved my stay at Hotel Ai Due Fanali. The hotel is pretty small (just 16 rooms) and its location is excellent, very close to the railway station. I liked the location because it was pretty close to everything and it was very convenient while coming back from our walking tours, since you can easily find signs leading to the "Ferrovia" (=railway station in Italian) almost everywhere in Venice. And getting lost in Venice can be very easy! My husband booked a superior room for us, which cost him 120 â‚¬ per night, breakfast included. The room was "superior" only because of the size, much bigger that the other ones, but honestly small. The furniture was really nice and cozy. The room had also a small (and fake!) firework and wooden celing. The room was very clean as we checked in and the maid kept it very clean during our stay. I think that this hotel features many positive qualities, such as: * Price: not so high, if you consider that you are staying within Venice in a very nice lodge. Consider that the room rate could have been lower if we had booked a normal room, and we were there during the peak season; * Location: walking distance to everything, pretty close to Santa Lucia railway station (3 minutes walk), where also all ferry boats leave and arrive (to and from Venice airport, for example); * Armosphere: very romantic if you are there with your beloved one. But what I liked most was the breakfast terrace, located on the 3rd floor, from where we could enjoy an awsome view of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in a practical location”
Reviews.Author: sleepyh
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the ai due Fanali in Venice and had a great time. We arrived quite late (11pm) due to our flight but the receptionist had waited for us and had our key ready for us. We had to check in at a different hotel across the road, and I was concerned we would have the switching con pulled on us, but all was fine. I think we were in room 102, which seemed to be one of the larger rooms from the floor plan and was big enough for the two of us. The black-out blinds were great to keep the light out, and carpet meant there was not much noise from other rooms. The bathroom was quite pokey with a short bath but the shower was great. The TV aerial cable was just a wire attached to the TV with sellotape which didn't work very well. The breakfast was great and we really enjoyed sitting on the terrace but the pidgeons were very persistent! The location for us was great, a short walk with our bags from the bus stop, likewise when we left we only had a short walk to the train station. For us, this was more practical than travelling across Venice with our luggage just to stay in a more central location. We loved Alaska, great gelateria round the corner and enjoyed sitting on the bench near the hotel looking over the Grand Canal

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: GinaZ41
Reviews.Content: Thought it had a "real Venice" feel to it: not glitzy, not a chain hotel, but unique, full of character and charm, clean, with nice touches and a professional staff. It's less than a 5 minute walk from the train station or bus square, which was very convenient for our coming and going: no need to haul our bags onto the water bus, just walked on over. Our room was quite small, but decent. Not fancy, but clean, neat and not a dive by any stretch. Bed linens and towels were very good quality. Bathroom was very small, but clean and water pressure was good. Staff spoke very good English and the lobby was quite nice. It was quiet, our room had a (small) view of the canal and I absolutely loved the top floor restaurant for breakfast: great view, great service, fantastic coffee and a very nice breakfast indeed. Loved walking from this more quiet area every day, through the gorgeous windy alleys, to the touristy areas, then retreating at the end of the day. Was only a 20 minute walk or so to St. Mark's square. Would defintely return!

Reviews.Title: “Could've been cooler ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend and elderly mother. It's very close to the train station, yet pleasantly outside the touristy hubbub. We enjoyed being away from the traps of Piazza San Marco. The elevator was a reasonable size for a European hotel, the rooftop breakfast deck offers great views, the bathrooms were nice and well-appointed, and the ceilings of the rooms were lovely wooden beams. Our one issue was the air-conditioning. They have it set about 6-8 degrees warmer than most people would set it for the summer, we figured. So we weren't opressed, but we found it ... well, more conservation-minded than we usually are on vacation. It was our one complaint, but one to consider if you're going in the summer, as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through reviews in two different travel books. Both said it was "charming" and a "find." I was really looking forward to this hotel. Well, it does have some charm (in the lobby area) and a location not too far from the train station; but the room was VERY SMALL and dingy. I requested a non-smoking room and while it had been some time since anyone smoked in it, the room had a faint smoke odor. A piece of furniture had been removed from the wall in our room and the bolts were left sticking out. Also the wall paper was scuffed and the room just felt in need of a good cleaning. The air conditioning worked, but not great. The bathroom was adequate but very small. Breakfast was also ok, but we had much better food (and rooms) at hotels in Rome and Florence. I can say the staff was very nice, but I would not stay here again and can not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Ai Due Fanali during the spring of 2000 and had such a positive experience! The accomodations were quaint and the rooms were kept very clean. The hotel is in a quiet section of the city and is relatively close to all of the major attractions. I would highly recommend Ai Due Fanali.

Reviews.Title: “A short but good stay..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the third & final leg of our honeymoon and liked this hotel the best. It was slightly difficult to find but the locals were very helpful with directions. Very well furnished and double room we occupied was a good size and with a lovely wood ceiling. Breakfast was a buffet which could be taken inside or on the roof terrace - beautiful views. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood, beautiful appointments”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for those, like us, who prefer not to be surrounded by other tourists. In an unusually quiet neighborhood in Santa Croce, close to several eating places beautifully situated on secondary canals and frequented almost exclusively by locals. Also close to THE BEST ice cream in Venice. Hpowever, it is a good 15 minute walk to the Rialto, close to half an hour to San Marco, so it is not for those who want to be close to the major tourist attractions. The rooms themselves are beautifully appointed. The one thing to beware of is if you are offered a "small" room, as we were. Even by European standards, the room we were in the first two night of our stay was ridiculoulsy small, and should not have been offered as a double. After the first two nights, we were switched to another room (the biggest in the hotel, we were told), which was very comfortable, although not terribly large. We were charged only 20 Euros more for teh second room, and stayed there for an additional five nights. All in all, a beautiful hotel, where we would certainly stay again provided one of the larger rooms was available.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel ai due Fanali
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce 946, 30135 Venice, Italy
